alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Maury; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:33AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lewis, southwestern Maury and southeastern Perry Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1233 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hohenwald, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hohenwald, Mount Pleasant, Gordonsburg, Kimmins, Culleoka and Hampshire. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
